means: 最不重要的，地位最低的
Learning Systems Standardization 学习系统标准化

sentence.Network_en: Try to eat at least four slices of bread a day.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天尽量至少吃4片面包。

sentence.Network_en: He is the least appealing character, to me at any rate.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是其中最没有吸引力的角色，至少对我来说是这样。

sentence.Network_en: At least three British golf courses are now owned by the Japanese.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在英国至少有3家高尔夫球场为日本人所有。

jx.jx_en_mean: (used after amounts) not less than; at the minimum

lj.lj_ly: stay ten days at the least.

jx.jx_en_mean: taking the most pessimistic or unfavourable view

lj.lj_ly: a programme which is, at the very least, excellent PR for the hospital.
lj.lj_ls: 一个从最坏方面讲也是对医院公共关系绝妙的项目。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)a difficult situation will be resolved more quickly if there is no more discussion of it
not in the smallest degree; not at all

lj.lj_ly: he was not in the least taken aback.
there is a great deal at stake, not least in relation to the environment.
lj.lj_ls: 涉及许多问题，特别是环境方面。

jx.jx_en_mean: used as an understatement (implying the reality is more extreme, usually worse)
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［一种以退为进的表达，暗示情况更严重］至少可以说

lj.lj_ly: his performance was disappointing to say the least.
lj.lj_ls: 至少可以说她的表演很令人失望。

jx.jx_en_mean: According to the lowest possible assessment; not less than
jx.jx_cn_mean: 至少：根据最低可能的判断；不少于

lj.lj_ls: 你不管怎样该给个答复

lj.lj_ly: I don't mind in the least.
Nobody cared, least of all the manager.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lǣst, lǣsest, of Germanic origin; related to less

encyclopedia.content: 基本释义 adj. 最小的；最少的（little的最高级） adv. 最小；最少 n. 最小；最少网络释义 最少 ... leasing trade 租赁贸易 Least 最少，最小 leastdeveloped counrty 最不发达国家 ...短语 Least Squares最小二乘法 ; 最小平方 ; 最小二乘 least action[物][经]最小作用量 least residue最小剩余

entry.def: You use at least to say that a number or amount is the smallest that is possible or likely and that the actual number or amount may be greater. The forms at the least and at the very least are also used.

example.ex: ...a dinner menu featuring at least 15 different sorts of fish...
example.tran: 至少列有15道不同做法的鱼的菜单

example.ex: Aim to have at least half a pint of milk each day...
example.tran: 目标是每天至少喝半品脱的牛奶。

entry.tran: （表示真实性或可能性）至少，最不济
entry.def: You use at least to say that something is the minimum that is true or possible. The forms at the least and at the very least are also used.

example.ex: She could take a nice holiday at least...
example.tran: 最不济她也可以去过一个愉快的假期。

example.ex: He is at least content that there will be no immediate use of force...
example.tran: 至少他对不会即时使用暴力感到满意。

entry.tran: （表示相对于不利条件或糟糕情形）起码，不管怎样
entry.def: You use at least to indicate an advantage that exists in spite of the disadvantage or bad situation that has just been mentioned.

example.ex: We've no idea what his state of health is but at least we know he is still alive...
example.tran: 我们不清楚他的健康情况如何，但起码知道他仍然活着。

example.ex: If something awful happens to you at least you can write about it.
example.tran: 如果你遭遇了不幸，至少你有东西可写。

entry.tran: （表示更正或改变自己刚说过的话）至少，起码
entry.def: You use at least to indicate that you are correcting or changing something that you have just said.

example.ex: It's not difficult to get money for research or at least it's  not always difficult...
example.tran: 争取到研究资金并不难，起码不总是那么难。

example.ex: The police say his death was an accident, officially at least...
example.tran: 警方说他的死是个意外，起码官方消息如此。

entry.def: You use the least to mean a smaller amount than anyone or anything else, or the smallest amount possible.

example.ex: I try to offend the least amount of people possible...
example.tran: 我尽量少得罪人。

example.ex: If you like cheese, go for the ones with the least fat.
example.tran: 要是喜欢吃奶酪，就吃脂肪含量最少的。

example.ex: On education funding, Japan performs best but spends the least per student.
example.tran: 在教育投资方面，日本花在每位学生身上的钱最少，但却做得最好。

entry.def: You use least to indicate that someone or something has less of a particular quality than most other things of its kind.

example.ex: The least experienced athletes had caused a great many false-starts through the day's proceedings...
example.tran: 那天的比赛中，经验最浅的运动员抢跑无数次。

example.ex: He was one of the least warm human beings I had ever met.
example.tran: 他是我见过的最冷漠的人之一。

entry.def: You use the least to emphasize the smallness of something, especially when it hardly exists at all.

example.ex: I don't have the least idea of what you're talking about...
example.tran: 我一点儿都不知道你在说什么。

example.ex: They neglect their duty at the least hint of fun elsewhere...
example.tran: 别处哪怕发生一丁点儿乐事，他们便会忘记自己的职责。

entry.def: You use least to indicate that something is true or happens to a smaller degree or extent than anything else or at any other time.

example.ex: He had a way of throwing her off guard with his charm when she least expected it.
example.tran: 他往往趁她最没有心理准备时发动魅力攻势，令她措手不及。

entry.tran: 无足轻重的；微乎其微的
entry.def: You use least in structures where you are emphasizing that a particular situation or event is much less important or serious than other possible or actual ones.

example.ex: Having to get up at three o'clock every morning was the least of her worries...
example.tran: 她发愁的事多着呢，相比之下，每天早上3点就要起床根本就不算什么。

example.ex: Although three days isn't very long, shortage of time was the least of his problems...
example.tran: 虽然3天时间不算长，但对他来说，这已经是最不成问题的问题了。

entry.def: You use the least in structures where you are stating the minimum that should be done in a situation, and suggesting that more should really be done.

example.ex: Well, the least you can do, if you won't  help me yourself, is to tell me where to go instead...
example.tran: 你自己要是不帮我，好歹也告诉我该上哪儿去呀。

example.ex: The least they could have given me was half a day to rest...
example.tran: 他们本应该起码给我半天时间休息。

entry.def: You can use in the least and the least bit to emphasize a negative.

example.ex: I'm not like that at all. Not in the least...
example.tran: 我哪里是那种人。绝对不是。

example.ex: I'm not in the least bit touched by the Marilyn Monroe kind of beauty...
example.tran: 我对玛丽莲·梦露那种美一点儿都不动心。

entry.tran: 最后不能不提；最后但同样重要的是
entry.def: You use last but not least to say that the last person or thing to be mentioned is as important as all the others.

example.ex: ...her four sons, Christopher, twins Daniel and Nicholas, and last but not least 2-year-old Jack.
example.tran: 她的4个儿子，克里斯托弗、双胞胎丹尼尔和尼古拉斯，还有不能不提的两岁大的杰克

entry.tran: （用于否定句后）（多者之中）尤其，尤数
entry.def: You can use least of all after a negative statement to emphasize that it applies especially to the person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: No one ever reads these articles, least of all me...
example.tran: 从没有人读这些文章，我就更不用说了。

example.ex: Such a speech should never have been made, least of all by a so-called responsible politician.
example.tran: 这种话本来就不应该说，尤其是不应出自一个所谓负责任的政客之口。

entry.tran: （强调某一例证或原因）尤其是，特别是，相当重要地
entry.def: You can use not least to emphasize a particularly important example or reason.

example.ex: Dieting can be bad for you, not least because it is a cause of stress...
example.tran: 节食可能不利于健康，相当重要的原因是它会引起精神压力。

example.ex: Everyone is more reluctant to travel these days, not least the Americans.
example.tran: 这段时间大家都减少了出游的欲望，美国人尤其如此。

entry.tran: 轻则；往轻里说；客气点说
entry.def: You can use to say the least to suggest that a situation is actually much more extreme or serious than you say it is.

example.ex: Accommodation was basic to say the least...
example.tran: 往轻里说是住宿条件简陋。

example.ex: Some members of the public can be a bit abusive to say the least.
example.tran: 有些民众客气点说是嘴里不大干净。

means.word_mean: 1. the superlative of `little' that can be used with mass nouns and is usually preceded by `the'; a quantifier meaning smallest in amount or extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "he has the least talent of anyone"

means.word_mean: 3. having or being distinguished by diminutive size;

sentences.sentence: "The garter snake is the least dangerous snake"

auth_sentence.content: Chill in the fridge for at least one hour.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chill in the fridge for at least one hour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chill in the fridge for at least one hour.

auth_sentence.content: The victory guarantees the pair at least a SILVER.
auth_sentence.res_content: The victory guarantees the pair at least a SILVER.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The victory guarantees the pair at least a SILVER.

auth_sentence.content: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.
auth_sentence.res_content: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So males at least do benefit from growing larger.

Sentence.sentence: Scientists are in general agreement that the warmer conditions we have been experiencing are at least in part the result of a human-induced global warming trend.
And a room with books in it induces, at least in some, a feeling not dissimilar to that of a fire in the fireplace on a cold winter's night
Read at least several chapters at one sitting.
Whereas language probably traces back at least 80.

At least four institutions - the University of Maryland, Oklahoma Christian University, Abilene Christian and Freed-Hardeman- have announced that they will give the devices to some or all of their students this fall.
Disaster movies often portray catastrophes that destroy, or at least threaten to destroy earth's entire population.

sentences.en: He did it well with the least money.
sentences.cn: 他用最少的钱把事办好了。

sentences.en: The least bit of dirt in a watch may make it stop.
sentences.cn: 表中哪怕有一点点污物都会使它不走动。

sentences.en: John chose the least expensive of the book in these books.
sentences.cn: 约翰在这些书中选了一本最便宜的。

sentences.en: He did the least of the work and got the most of the money.
sentences.cn: 他干活最少, 拿钱却最多。

jushi.english: Those who are the least interested in such matters are welcome to contact us.
jushi.chinese: 欢迎那些即使是对这件事最不感兴趣的人与我们合作。

jushi.english: The least worry we have is about the weather.
jushi.chinese: 我们最不担心的就是天气。

jushi.english: The story was dramatic without being in the least sentimental.
jushi.chinese: 该短篇小说富有戏剧性而又不矫情感伤。
